result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Scott Davis

records.addlTxt:
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Robert Scott Davis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Robert Scott Davis.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status conference.  No objection from the State.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Scott Davis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Robert Scott Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Haley Wentz
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kohl's Department Store
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Robert Scott Davis appeared by video, in custody at Kettle Moraine Correctional.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Robert Scott Davis.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Return on Warrant/Initial appearance scheduled via Zoom. Defendant is in custody at Kettle Moraine Correctional.  Defendant unable to appear.  Intake Coordinator will reschedule.
Received and Filed: Request for Prompt Disposition
Initial appearance scheduled via Zoom. Defendant is in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Defendant failed to appear.  Intake Coordinator will reschedule.
Letter from defendant re:  clearing warrant on this case.  (Robert S. Davis - #102670, Waukesha County Jail, PO Box 0217, Waukesha WI 53186).
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
